moves.1. Nf3 g6 2. e4 Bg7 3. d4 d6 4. Bc4 c6:
1.	Nf3	g6
2.	e4	Bg7
3.	d4	d6
4.	Bc4	c6 this is somethin i never played before, or just once or twice. I decided to test with an opponent I supposed stronger than me.
moves.5. c3 Nf6 6. Nbd2 O-O 7. e5: competely unknown to me... I had to think a lot.
moves.7... dxe5 8. Nxe5 Nbd7 9. Ndf3: i clerly let him inside. But i did not feel that uncomfortable.
moves.9... Nd5 10. Qe2 e6: this sounded like "ok let's play a draw."
moves.11. Ng4 Nd7f6 12. Nh6+: not from him. I expected some exchange here.
moves.16. O-O-O: Hm... i like that. I thought about counter-play from now.
moves.16... Be6 17. g4: and he helped me to centralize
moves.17... Nf6 18. Ne5 Ne4: let us go on the other side.
moves.19. Nd3 Rae8 20. Rdg1: who is going to arrive first? Seems to be him.
moves.22... g5: try to force him back. I saw many complications here.
moves.23. hxg5 Nxc3: and this is one of them! I decided to sacrifice anyway
moves.24. bxc3 Qxc3+ 25. Qc2 Qxc2+ 26. Kxc2 fx: i hoped him to take my pawn so i could take back his and double the rooks.
moves.27... Rxf3 28. Bxg7+ Kxg7 29. Ne5 Rf2+: the calm white rooks are very frigthening from the beginning. They look like elephants waiting to roll on the infantry.
moves.30. Kb3 c5 31. dxc5 d4+ 32. Nc4: he let me nothing... I still hope to find a way to perpetual check
moves.33... Kg6 34. Kb4 a5+: if he takes, i can make perpetual check
moves.35... Rxa2 36. Nf5 Bxc4+: hm... i think i had no more option
moves.38... Kf7 39. Rxh7+: and this is the beginning of the end.
moves.44. Nb7 Rdf8 45. Rd6+ Ke4 46. Rd1 Rf8f3: all right, better to give up: i have nothing more. But i liked the game. Thank you justnow.
